newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE world sugar was called to open mostly unchanged Thursday, dealers said.

The market could follow through to the upside, with resistance pegged at 11.34 cents a lb, followed by 11.42 cents, for most-active October. Technical support remained at 11.00 cents, followed by the recent low of 10.96 cents, for the contract. A move below support could set off sell stops and trigger speculative liquidation, trading sources said.
Wednesday, July sugar settled 0.07 cent higher at 11.15 cents, with October up 0.11 cent at 11.26 cents. The rest rose 0.10 to 0.12.
The July/October spread closed at 0.11 cent October premium, compared with 0.07 cent on the previous close.

LIFFE white sugar futures were mixed at midsession as the market await the open of New York. At 0845 EDT/1245 GMT, the spot August contract stood $1.20 higher at $320.10, while the rest of the board was trading unchanged to $0.50 lower.
